--0-1963407711-1215894919=:86834
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=iso-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

Wise advice here.  I can also give you the Boson Netsim collection so you can learn and do simulations of router/switch configs for different situations.

You just need to be willing to put in the time.


"John B." <svnlyrbrto@gmail.com> wrote: My company is hiring CSRs and managers.  Unfortunately, our warehouse  
and call center are in Texas. The San Francisco office is mainly  
engineers and merchandisers.  But if you have friends or family in the  
Dallas area and are considering relocating...

... I'm assuming not though.  After all, who would want to goto Texas,  
once you've seen California?

City College is $20 per credit.  I'm working towards my CCNA there  
myself.  It's a good, well-equipped, program.  And they have both  
night and saturday classes so it won't interfere with your work  
schedule.  Considering how much of a pay bump that is, it may be worth  
breaking down and putting it on a card.  The new program even puts all  
the course materials online, so there's no added cost for the  
textbooks. Plus, there's financial aid.  Yes, even City College is  
eligible for it.  I don't know the details because I never bothered.   
But it's all over their website.  Fall semester is in registration now.

I don't even HAVE the thing yet, and I've had a couple of people  
approach me about my impending shift from QA to IT.  That IPv6  
transition is looming on the horizon getting ready to drop on  
everyone's heads, after all.

If you don't want to put the classes on a card and run up more debt,  
and can't afford $120 per semester, you might consider picking up a  
second job at a Starbucks.  I worked at one for a while during the  
hardcore tech doldrums.  And it's not a bad deal at all.

If you work more than 20 hours a week, you qualify for full benefits.   
So that takes care of your health coverage right there; and for your  
other job you can pick one with no bennies and a few more bucks per  
hour.  You get some miscellaneous other perks, including a fantastic  
discount at 24-Hour Fitness.  Those free pounds of coffee every week  
make for great low-cost gifts.  (Who doesn't like coffee, after all?)   
All the free coffee you can drink yourself.  If you work closings and  
have a cool manager, you can eat well on the leftovers.  And here's  
the kicker:  once you've been there for a while, they do TUITION  
REIMBURSEMENT.

And no, that's not just tuition reimbursement for food service related  
certs.  They'll cover tech certs and general degree programs as well.

Busting ass and working two jobs is never fun; especially when you're  
going to school too.  But get a couple of tech certifications under  
your belt, and your worries will be over.  I think that's the biggest  
mistake I ever made after the dotcoms collapsed... not getting my ass  
own right back into school ASAP.


cya,
john


On Jul 11, 2008, at 23:53,  
 > wrote:
>
> 2. To get certed for ANYTHING would cost me money I don't have, so  
> while I could potentially sit at home and do nothing but study shit,  
> I wouldn't have any certs or be able to put it on a resume as  
> experience.

Subject: [sfraves] short term, or longer, sublet available in creative and fun mission

in the community could be looking.  Rent is $600/mo, or $200/wk, which 
includes utilities.

It's one room in large communal house.  It's LARGE!  It's also 
furnished.

Shared kitchen and living room.
Balcony with a view and lots of plants.

The people living here are friendly, creative types, which include
artists, designers, dancers, musicians, etc. Bicyclist friendly.
No TV watchers in the house. (We do watch movies though.)  We also have
2 very friendly cats.

Available for short to multi-month terms.

Hope to hear from some interesting folks!

----- Original Message ----
From: Holt Sorenson <hso@hsomusic.com>
To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
Sent: Monday, July 14, 2008 10:07:00 AM
Subject: [sfraves] BSP: Chris Leath / Holt mixing live right now!!


Please tune in to KZSU by listening to 90.1 in the Bay Area or pointing
your web browser to http://kzsulive.stanford.edu.

If you're interested in guest appearing on any of our shows
or having a mix featured contact us using our email addresses
or: electronicadjs@kzsu.stanford.edu

Big Love Show with Jack - Mon 3PM-6PM Pacific/US
------------------------------------------------

Chris Leath commenced 'djing' in 1995 and continues going strong.
He is a producer of multiple genres of electronic music and a promoter
of conscious venues. DJ Leath's is musically influenced by artists
such as: Jeff Mills, Stevie Wonder, Derrick May, Cocteau Twins, Ritchie
Hawton, Brian Eno, Robert Rich, and Billie Holiday. Chris mind blowing
sets include styles such as ambient, experimental, drum and bass,
jungle, techno and electro. Chris and his brother, Paul, team up on
El Otro Mundo productions. They also host a couple of online radio
shows.

More information about Chris Leath and El Otro Mundo can be found at:
http://hsomusic.com/sh/r
http://hsomusic.com/sh/q

Eclektronik Groove w/ Holt Sorenson - Mon 10AM-12PM Pacific/US
-----------------------------------------------------------

Holt is mixing live for you on Monday, from 9AM-12PM.


Epiphany of Sound with J.C. - Th 9AM-12PM Pacific/US
----------------------------------------------------

After 14 years, DJ J.C.'s techno/house/electronica showcase has
garnered much attention and devotion. Like most folks at Stanford's
radio station, he's a volunteer, proving that his motivation isn't
a paycheck; it's his passion to share his interest in one of music's
most eclectic genres. With his conversational style, inclusion of
producers and musicians from both the local & international scene,
and his stewardship of the station's 24-hour marathons during
Solstices and Equinoxes, it's no wonder that DJ J.C has made a
connection with listeners in a very crowded market. Catch his live
broadcasts or listen to the previous week's program at underheard.org.

J.C. will email this week if he has an update on any guests.

--
Holt Sorenson/Eclektronik Groove
hso@hsomusic.com
hsomusic.com - myspace.com/hsomusic
KZSU (kzsulive.stanford.edu) show Th @ 6-9AM US/Pacific

choices too but apparently suffer from wear and stuff.

Subject: [sfraves] partial decibel lineup released


i'm not involved in this event other than thinking it is awesome, worth
making the trek up to seattle for, and wanting to encourage the cool
people i met over the years from sfraves to go. :)


PRELIMINARY LINEUP (final line up TBA mid August):

Carl Craig (US) - DJ
Deadmau5 (CA) - Live
Jahcoozi (DE) - Live
The Bug featuring Warrior Queen (UK) - Live
Dixon (DE) - Live
Audion (US) - Live
Burnt Friedman (DE) - Live
Luca Bacchetti (IT) - DJ
Tujiko Noriko (JP) - Live
Santiago & Bushido (US) - Live
Barbara Morgenstern (DE) - Live
Deaf Center (NO) - Live
William Basinski (US) - Live
Jeff Samuel (US/DE) - DJ
Library Tapes (SE) - Live
Akira Rabelais (US) - Live
Mike Monday (US) - DJ
Eluvium (US) - Live
Tycho (US) - Live
Noah Pred (CA) - Live
Derek Plaslaiko (US) - Live
Eskmo (US) - Live
Kilowatts (US) - Live
Alland Byallo (US) - DJ
Jeff Greinke (US) - Live
Welder (US) - Live
Jacob London (US) - Live
Deru (US) - Live
Lusine (US) - Live
Craig Kuna (US) - DJ
Nalepa (US) - Live
Nikola Baytala (US) - DJ
Sammy D (US) - DJ
Truckasauras (US) - Live
Baln (US) - Live
M. Quiet (US) - DJ
Let's Go Outside (US) - Live
Alala.One (US) - DJ
Attentat (US) - DJ
Les Freres Courvoisier (US) - Live

details at http://www.dbfestival.com/

Back in the day when I lived in Palo Alto in the late 1990s my # then was
650-321-CASH.

Hated giving that up in a move in the days when you couldn't port yr #.

Now as far as this particular # goes....

me damn it me me me me

give it to meeeeeeeeeeeeeeeee!!!!!

that # should be mine, mine

ALL mine.

never mind my b-day is the same as Alexander Graham Bell's, (telephone
inventor 4 u YouTube kids), and that I worked at AdultFriendFinder on the
Abuse Desk and smoke copious amounts of the herb...

No, none of that.

The main qualifier is this email addy which has been subbed to sfr since
gmail was by invite only.

That alone should put me in the top slot for possession of that which is
rightfully mine.

That and I am a complete and total Kentucky stir-fried Day-Glo phareak,
here's my dating pic:   http://tinyurl.com/69y48m

Go ahead and laff all u want, u have *no idea* how much play I've gotten out
of that one pic, especially considering I grew that bad boy myself in my
gf's garden.

It's the 'make 'em laff and you're halfway there' ice-breaker from hell.

:-P

~~Nyc

do know this; anytime you go by a House of Worship, of any size, and of any
denomination, that's filled to its rafters with people, you can be certain
that the vast majority of those people haven't actually taken the time out

Subject: Re: [sfraves] Good carts/needles?

----------MB_8CAB4226F87E07E_AB0_40BC_webmail-nb18.sysops.aol.com
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"


 I settle for the Ortofon blue. These needles tend to be very neutral to many different turntable settings and are not too agressive so, your record sound quality last longer. The M44 and white lable are probably some of the best tracking and sounding needles, even better that Ortofons (when settings on tables are optimum) but, better tracking and lounder needles come at a price, of your vinyl. 
Just as a footnote; Sure head shell needles didnt get where they are now without the help of Q-bert. He pushed for developement and upgrading design by Sure.? When they stoped further research of needles, this is when Q-bert went to Ortofon.

-Hil

Ray Wong <rayw@rayw.net> wrote: 

The whitelabels seem to be the standard from DJs I've watched, the rest tend to
be other things they settle for/can afford.  Stanton Trackmasters, Ortofon
Concorde Nightclub E, Stanton 500s (may not track quite as well) are popular
choices too but apparently suffer from wear and stuff.

-R.

phones, iPods, and minds like empty rooms, I still plod along with books."
Harper Lee 2006

"There aren't a lot of thing in this world that one can be sure of, but I do
know this; anytime you go by a church that's filled to the
rafters with people you can be sure that the vast majority of them haven't
read The Bible, because if they had, that church would be
nearly empty." Nyc Alberts 2006

Subject: [sfraves] Body Choir SF August 1st-3rd

------=_Part_378_17641837.1216084105661
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
Content-Disposition: inline

Hey everyone. There's a dance workshop coming up that some of the people who
work at Cafe Gratitude are putting on. (me included) It's called Body Choir,
and it's kinda a combination of Contact improve, Gabrielle Roth's 5 Rhythm
practice, and native american ritual dance. There are body choir groups all
over the world, and this is a workshop that introduces the practice. There
will be weekly dances held immediately after the workshop.

Here's what the flyer says, " Body Choir is an introspective and
interpersonally guided educational experience, inspired by the foundational
work of Gabrielle Roth's 5 Rhythm practice, Jospeh Campbell's archetypes,
and Native American ritual dance. Our doors are open to everyone seeking a
uniquely guided dance experience of raising inner awareness through
exploration of moverment and sound in the body. We welcome a wide range of
ethnicities, abilities and ages. Come help us build a community.

email: bodychoirsf@gmail.com

607-227-3788 or 512-944-8486

http://www.myspace.com/bodychoirsf

------=_Part_378_17641837.1216084105661--

Subject: [sfraves] DJ MISJAH @ 222 Hyde st. july 22nd

 Throughout the entire time i've been djing and buying techno music i've 
been wanting to see this guy play.  I have to hand it to blipswitch for 
bringing him out to SF and Anatoli Russki for bringing him out to 
headline in Miami.

For me, Misjah is up there with Adam Beyer, Joel Mull, DJ Hell, 
Alexander Kowalski and Sven Vath in the top ten can't miss DJs and 
producers. To have kenneth graham and alland in support, this is going 
to fuuhhking rock!

`;P***

sean.

Subject: Re: [sfraves] DJ MISJAH @ 222 Hyde st. july 22nd

Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
Content-Disposition: inline

everyone i know that has been there pretty much LOVES the 222.

brick interior, very intimate, basement houseparty feel.

nice staff, good sound, just overall a cool little spot.

it's honestly about my favorite venue in the city for small events.

there's pics of the venue on their myspace profile, here...

http://www.myspace.com/222hyde

recommended. check it out.

---->gb

=== WEDNESDAY 07/16

DJ Three @ Anu
http://i216.photobucket.com/albums/cc260/scottcarrelli/three_july16_new_72dpi.jpg



=== THURSDAY 07/17

Evil Eddie Richards + Nikola Baytala @ Vessel - FREE
http://needletothewax.250free.com/We.jpg



=== FRIDAY 07/18

Killswitch x2 @ Underground SF w/ Roman Stange, Eo, MossMoss, J Moody,
Tomkat, more
http://i151.photobucket.com/albums/s142/davidjavate/july18web.jpg">

Dirtybird @ Shine w/ Worthy, Mosaic, J.Phlip
http://a673.ac-images.myspacecdn.com/images01/106/l_619293b1746011977db944c74387c5e8.jpg
">



=== SATURDAY 07/19

Black Market Techno @ Oasis w/ Keith Kemp, Clint Stewart, Staple, more
http://a121.ac-images.myspacecdn.com/images01/10/l_0290c39d1c4e6121d8de723d9be85778.jpg
">

Beat Symposium underground w/ Craig Kuna, Barclay Spring, more
http://www.phamilygathering.com/images/bsb.jpg



=== SUNDAY 7/20

Sunset boat party w/ John Tejada
http://pacificsound.net/fliers/2008/sunset_boat_7.20.jpg



=== TUESDAY 7/22

Blipswitch @ 222 Hyde w/ DJ Misjah, Kenneth Graham, Alland Byallo, more
http://blipswitch.com/eflyers/july22/july22_flyer_web.gif



=== SATURDAY 07/26

Platform 7.0 underground @ 58 Tahama w/ Nikola Baytala, Craig Kuna, Alland
Byallo, Kenneth Scott, more
http://a426.ac-images.myspacecdn.com/images01/1/l_556ced8b158cb5b3517f48a457115cf9.jpg



=== SUNDAY 07/27

Booka Shade (live) + Kontrol DJs @ Mezzanine
http://a215.ac-images.myspacecdn.com/images01/117/l_0ac8ce5d15f60632be69140ad80eea4e.jpg



=== THURSDAY 07/31

Spektikal @ the Endup w/ Monocle (live), MossMoss, Jamie James, more
http://i54.photobucket.com/albums/g119/mattieoh/MONOCLEmossmossENDUP.jpg

Subject: [sfraves] (nrr) QOD (Tue)

If anyone has any contacts or works at Google, please email me, I know  
someone who is interested in a job there.  Thanks.

--

Here's how the figures add up, just for Americans. The wars in
Afghanistan and Iraq have thus far produced 300,000 psychological
casualties, 320,000 brain injury casualties, plus 35,000 (probably
understated) officially reported "normal" casualties. This adds up to
655,000 US casualties in Iraq and Afghanistan, an average of just
under 101,000 Americans killed or wounded every year since the wars
began. If the idea of 101,000 casualties for every extra year in Iraq
and Afghanistan gets out and infects the voting public, imagine the
effect on the currently torpid national debate over leaving in five
years versus fifteen years!

- Alexander Cockburn

Source:  Real Clear Numbers, http://counterpunch.org/cockburn05102008.html

------=_Part_14059_9198206.1216153854370
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
Content-Disposition: inline

re: why sunday?

mezzanine booked the show, and kontrol was asked to support.

shows happen on sundays cuz sometimes that's the only time the artists are
available!   odds are, booka shade are playing somewhere on the west coast
(seattle, la, etc) on friday and saturday, and were looking for a sunday gig
to fill out their schedule.

since artists will usually drop their fees a bit for a non-weekend gig, and
there's often not as much competition on those nights, some times it makes
sense to do these kinda shows on a sunday (or weds, or whatever).

often the choice is, sunday show, or no show at all.  they went with the
show option!

that's life sometimes, right?

----->gb

Subject: [sfraves] BSP: Rock It Science Upcoming Events 7/26 Underground, 8/9 .dotbleep (Advance Announcement)

------=_Part_31083_8202717.1216236985880
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
Content-Disposition: inline

Howdy folks,

Do people still plan their partying in advance?  We didn't think so, but
last time we dropped the word the week of an underground party we got a
couple of replies that peeps would like more notice.  We have assumed it
best to just make one post as not to spam.

More info will be posted the week of the events.

Keep raving!!

July 26, Rock It Science presents Dirty Secrets

Underground loft party with Anthony Mansfield, Andrew Phelan, Homero
Espinosa, Eric Sharp, Michael Anthony, Lachlan Scotland, and White Girl Lust

August 9th, .dotbleep Invades San Francisco presented by Rock It Science and
Temple Nightclub

Limited $10 earlybird advance tickets available at
http://www.going.com/dotbleepsf

Talent: Justin Long (Chicago), Tari of Trademarq (Denver) & more

See you folks on the dancefloor soon!

The Rock It Science Squad

------=_Part_31083_8202717.1216236985880--

reported it the moment it was noticed=2C and he took a couple of months to =
fix it. I paid my water bill for the beginning of the year=2C but apparentl=
y he was disputing the total with SPEC=2C and got them to adjust it (I gues=
s it got pretty astronomical).=20

rom those months. An additional $265 over what I had already paid for a wat=
er bill.  Due to the fact that my last rent check was super late=2C we agre=
ed to pay the bill....but we mentioned that during half of the billing cycl=

My questions:=20

A. Is it fair or legal for him to charge us my ex-roomies portion?

B. Is it fair or legal for him to charge us an adjusted amount over what wa=
s already paid due to his negligence in fixing the problem?=20

I suggest that you look into a free legal clinic, if it's worth it to you.

You might try the SF Bar Association's Legal Advice and Referral Clinic
(LARC):
http://www.sfbar.org/volunteer/larc.aspx

Apparently their next clinic is on July 26. I don't know how long you might
expect to spend there, but generally it helps to show up early during the
registration period.

Good luck...

Damon

X-Mailer: YahooMailRC/1042.40 YahooMailWebService/0.7.218
Date: Wed, 16 Jul 2008 17:03:00 -0700 (PDT)
From: dangrsmind@yahoo.com
To: electrofunk138@hotmail.com, sfraves@hyperreal.org
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii
Message-ID: <495150.36415.qm@web32406.mail.mud.yahoo.com>
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: Re: [sfraves] NRR: SF rental law question....

Who's name is on the lease?  The leaseholder is liable for any fees and charges specified in the lease.

But no he can't charge you for water use due to a leak due to a reported problem he didn't fix assuming you reported it to him.  Our landlord has been trying this for two years now and my wife totally slammed him on it.

There are strict rules about passing on increased water bills to tenants in San Francisco.  Your landlord will have to document the increase by presenting past bills.  Contact the SF rent board for more information.

http://www.sfgov.org/site/rentboard_index.asp?id=2142

Peter



----- Original Message ----
From: "electrofunk138@hotmail.com" <electrofunk138@hotmail.com>
To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
Sent: Wednesday, July 16, 2008 4:53:16 PM
Subject: [sfraves] NRR: SF rental law question....


If anyone can help...

My landlord neglected to fix a leaky toilet in my unit back in February. I reported it the moment it was noticed, and he took a couple of months to fix it. I paid my water bill for the beginning of the year, but apparently he was disputing the total with SPEC, and got them to adjust it (I guess it got pretty astronomical). 

A couple of weeks ago he slammed me and my roomie with an "adjusted" bill from those months. An additional $265 over what I had already paid for a water bill.  Due to the fact that my last rent check was super late, we agreed to pay the bill....but we mentioned that during half of the billing cycle there were two other tenants living here (my ex roommates), and that it seemed like they ought to be liable for their portion.

My questions: 

A. Is it fair or legal for him to charge us my ex-roomies portion?

B. Is it fair or legal for him to charge us an adjusted amount over what was already paid due to his negligence in fixing the problem? 


Marc(O)
OtherWorld // Cable Wednesdays // The MidnightSons (SF)
www.myspace.com/the_uber_wop
www.myspace.com/illectrofunk
www.themidnightsons.com

The liberties of our country, the freedoms of our civil Constitution
are worth defending at all hazards; it is our duty to defend them
against all attacks. We have received them as a fair inheritance from
our worthy ancestors. They purchased them for us with toil and danger
and expense of treasure and blood. It will bring a mark of everlasting
infamy on the present generation, enlightened as it is, if we should
suffer them to be wrested from us by violence without a struggle, or
to be cheated out of them by the artifices of designing men.

- Samuel Adams

Source:  Devvy Kidd, Slap the King, Expect to Die:
http://www.newswithviews.com/Devvy/kidd149.htm

Subject: [sfraves] Thanks! was Re: [sfraves] we should ALL be ashamed of ourselves

Thanks for all the Bday wishes gang.

I was never one to taught what year I was born in - I never really figured 
numbers meant much, especially in this circle (...and hell at 60, my mom 
still gets carded in dark places) so being outed on the year I turn 40 don't 
bother me none.  Nobody seems to believe it anyway (including myself), so 
more power to me, I say...

As for you youngins freaking out on me in private on how "old" you're 
surprised to find out I am, I'm still the same person and figure I'm living 
proof that you can stop the aging process on many degrees.  And screw the 
numbers....

For most who choose to actually go out and live, "age" brings about it 
wisdom, and yeah Ray, the ablility to drink great big men under the table... 
and a whole lotta memories - but let's not fiddle... I'm just getting 
started....

again... thanks y'all...

now back to my nap...

LOL

Quick updates: 

1) Flook from Acid Totem has agreed to fill in an open slot in our second room. 

2) Terry is stuck in Lake Tahoe, so we decided to pull out the BIG GUNS: PARADISE2012 will be performing a LIVE HIGH-DEFINITION CGI visuals installation in our Garden of Psychoactive Delights. I would pay $5 just to watch this alone!!!

3) Special guest act is scheduled to play 1:30 - 2:30 in the main room, however "it" will not be announced until tomorrow- by word of mouth only!


>>>>


Saturday July 19th (SF): ALL FUNKIN' NIGHT!
 
Taking place at a fresh (but tested) UG Location, SF. $5 B4 12.
 
Celebrate the 24-hour tradition of good vibes, debauchery, and sensory overdrive while jamming to:
 
The Fingermonsters (Shazbot, Origami, Andrew Phelan, Cubik- SF)- LIVE PA
Ben Haus (Acid Totem)
Red Stickman (Ambient Mafia)
Hil Huerta (YBD, Skills, 1015, CaliGrown)
Holt Sorenson (HSO Music, KZSU)
Marc(o) (Otherworld, Cable Wednesdays)
Flook (Acid Totem, The Experiment)

+ Special opening set by Pinkko!
 
and CaliGrown DJ's Dean Kroh, Dangrsmind, Chuck .G
 
But wait. . . there's more!!11!1!
 
SPECIAL GUEST ACT FROM 1:30 - 2:30. . . WILL NOT BE ANNOUNCED PRIOR TO DAY OF EVENT!
 
That's right! Better believe we're going to pull all the stops for this one. . . 

 
Mind Melting LIVE Visual performance by PARADISE2012! Psychoactive environment collaborated between Eyezmind, CaliGrown, and our gracious host(s). FREE GIVEAWAYS & OTHER DOPE SURPRISES!!!


$5.00 before midnight. (18+ w. ID, Drinks for 21+ w. ID) LIMITED CAPACITY - ARRIVE EARLY!
 
Check out CaliGrownEvents.com for directions & updates.
 
peace!
 
C.G.

for "To The 5 Boroughs" album at radio station in Washington DC's Chinatown

Subject: Re: [sfraves] BSP: ALL FUNKIN' NIGHT! TOMORROW! (+ updates)

Sorry I won't be making it tonight.

I was visiting my client up in Tahoe and took a nasty spill in 
their hotel. Ended up with paramedics, a busted open chin 
requiring stitches, a mild concussion, and various other 
not-so-pleasant injuries.

I just got back, but I gotta take it easy for a day or 10. I 
haven't skipped out on doing visuals in a very long time, hope 
my excuse is good enough. Thanks Chuck for tracking me down and 
expressing your concern.

I got to see the space last week though, it's really unique. 
It's gonna be an awesome party :-)

-terry

From sfraves-return-147695-sfraves-archive=hyperreal.org@hyperreal.org Mon Jul 21 03:19:36 2008

Message-ID: <2062.71.198.250.91.1216610384.squirrel@secure.saturn5.com>
Date: Sun, 20 Jul 2008 20:19:44 -0700 (PDT)
From: "Osby Oi Oi Jamz" <osby@viberation.com>
To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
Reply-To: osby@viberation.com
User-Agent: SquirrelMail/1.4.10a

X-Priority: 3 (Normal)

X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] WR: So Yummy All Fuckin' Night!!!!

ok... so like lol.. to get to the venue was a journey... I rode BART & a
guy who smelled like pepperoni pizza sat in front of me then his small
kinda shifted to something rank... then i caught Muni which actually took
me deeper into the City & further away from my destination to catch a bus
that went to the venue... lol.. so yeah... mondo confuzion... then since i
didn't have a cell phone on me.. it took 1/2 an hour until I met residents
who live in the hood to call Chuckie for me so I wouldn't hold their his
phone & yeah... it was kinda weird, but yeah... got there finally!

But yeah... oooh.. ok.. so the venue is like so Awesome!!  I mean...
small, not your typical kinda ummm... space i guess... but it like
heeeeella reminded me of all the old school like undergrounds that like
were in office building & stuff kinda dealie :)  ooh.. 1 of my highlights
was get worked on from a Chiropractor & oooh.. he fixed me sooo good!!! 
YUM!!!

OK... I also gotta say that this was seriously like an unofficial SFR
party 'cause sooo many SFR heads showed up.. seriously.. if this was back
in the day, like Lida & Tina woulda busted out an SFR meet up table or
something... lol :)  But yeah... it was Dope!  Grrr... i wish i got pixes
of you all.. but umm... yeah

OK... the music was Sick... i mean... Jungle for opening a fuckin' room?? 
Hell fuckin' yeah man!!!  I mean.. i still mondo HATE PINKKO w/ the
passion (lol... jk... i don't), but fuck yeah... he started out all Liquid
Funky.. then his set just got all i dunno... more yummy!!!  I dunno man..
the music was Awesome.. I mean... I heard alota yummy house in the main
room & y'all know how picky i am about my house... so yeah.. I was
Groovin' hard... all the music I heard man... fuck yeah!!  I'm sorry Peter
I didn't get to like see you drop ch00nage.. but yeah.. the co-hosting
dealie was like confuzing at 1st!


Oooh yeah... so like yeah... I was the Free goodies give away dude... like
I tried reeeeeally hard to get everyone w/ a necklace or a CD or a lighter
& luckily.. maybe 4-5 people who i showed too much Love to I gave like all
4 things... but yeah... lol... it was fun giving out presents to people!! 
So Dope!!!

As soon as my bag-o-goodies ran out.. i mean.. i was suppose to like
refill & stock up w/ like more stuff... but ummm... 1/2 birthday present
#1
& 1/2 Birthday present #2 started havin' this hardcore jungle shindig in
my body & head... so ummm, yeah, Hello 2Day... i kinda needed to ride that
instead of like ummm... being Santa Raver... & yeah... everyone who gave
me 1/2 Birthday gifts... ooh my goodness.. Tahnk Y'all so much.. I mean..
i'm havin' the hangover from hell right & loading up on my water/ caffine
in take... but yeah... Oooh fuck yeah.. Love U all sooo much!!!  LoL!!! 
Yeah.. everyone there lastnight... Big Love!!!

Oh yeah... the start of the night, like a bus load of Candy kids were 1st
to get there... it was Cute 'cause there were already high & suckin' on
their pacifires! :)  I mean.. the crowd was pretty mixed.. there was even
a group of I odnt give a fuck Neo NAzi skin punkrockers that showed up & I
mean.. they were kindfa rude.. but there was just sooo much goo d energy
that no one paid mind to them :)  But yeah... it was good energy all
night!!!  Loved it!!!

I mean... what sucked hard donkey balls was that I mean.. the party ended
a lil early shavin' off 2 sets 'cause cops showed up... but I mean... the
vibe of the party was so strong & as the venue owner said, "... it was the
peak of the party & the energy and the vibes were really strong, that the
party ended at the right moment 'cause if it went on any longer, there
would of been an energy fizzle"... so yeah... so Dope!!!  I mean...
regardless... it was a perfect night!!!

Yo Chuckie... seriously HomiE... big fuckin' ups dude on pulling this
off... you set out on a mission to make people happy all fuckin' night &
everyone was!!  You went above & beyond the call of Dutie & even though
Mister "I'm 34 yrs old & I know what's goin' on here", fresh outta the cop
academy police officer ended things a wee lil earlier than planned, people
still had sooo much fun!!  You did it & I'm hella proud of you man!!! 
Ooooh, & Thanks sooo much for letting me be a part of the madness!!  LoL..
Hello 2day... this underground really lifted things up in my life a few
notches & I'm afterglowin' hardcore Homie!!!  You did it!!  You seriously
really did :)

OK... I need to nurse my hangover a lil more & probs potato in front of my
TV... but fuck man... lol.. I can't stop fucin' smiling & thinkin' about
the so mondo yummy it was lastnight... but yeah... even cleaning up I was
all giggely as fuck still 'cause it was just ooh man... what i needed &
I'm sure many people left feeling the same way I still do :)

YAAAY 4 the underground!!!

-- 
Take Care <3
Peace=->Jus' Me =-> ObY {8O)

For additional commands, e-mail: sfraves-help@hyperreal.org

Subject: [sfraves] fable's funky funkn night!!

CHUCK G and his lady are the SHIT!  GOOD PEEPS.

Me and my wife arrived at the party pretty early.  It was pretty empty when we arrived, but the first person I saw sitting at the entrance was OSBY!! WOOHOO!!

Osby gave me a big ass hug and finally got to meet my wife for the first time.  I looked over and there was Chuck G's woman, Megan!  She was so cool and just had a good vibe which started the night off right.

First impressions of the location was a family house feel.  Very awesome, I immediately decided, that this wasn't some warehouse party, the venue needed to be treated with respect as if it was someone's home.

We finally ran into Chuck and I could tell that he was hella busy, but he still went out of his way to show us around and introduce us to some peeps.  I can't stress what cool people Chuck and his crew are, their mentality is what has kept the scene alive and positive to this day.

30 minutes passed and I had a boston lager draft in one hand and a blunt in the other.  I was in the chill room and this one dude with long hair was chillin with us in the circle.  He seemed to be part of the organizer crews cuz he was fine-tuning some of the decorations.  I ended up ashing on the floor cuz I had no where else to ash and the dude gave me the look.  I felt kinda bad, so I scooped up all my ashes with my business card and made sure I left no mess behind.

So, some sweet dnb was going in one room and house in the other.  After listening to the first few songs in the dnb room, my wife wanted to go dance in the housey type room on the bottom floor.  We started dancing and were feelin the music so much that we started doing the merengue with a little housey twist which I thought was hella dope!  Then, Osby comes over and says to us, "This isn't the lambada guys!"  Then my wife said, "I'm not Brazilian!" but I dont think he heard, haha!

Osby came by later and hooked me up with a fatty green bushy necklace that somewhat resembled herb, I had to let it hang out of my back pocket tho, cuz it was tickling my wifes face when we danced.

Sadly, we had to cut out early cuz a friend of ours got stuck without a ride.  We were bummed about this cuz things looked like they were just about to pop off! *sniff*

I was only able to say goodbye to Megan and she seems down that we left early.

Chuck, Megan and the rest of the crew, thank you so much for a dope ass night!  This wasn't just some party, it was a family affair.  

fable....

I was pleasantly surprised by all the different party types that showed up.
It's definitely something most parties are unable to accomplish, and don't
even try to.  You pulled it off, and it worked out well.  I was really
feelin' the stuff that Michael was layin down before I went on.  More people
need to book him for non-downtempo music!  I had originally intended to go
home around 2 and get some sleep, but I stayed til the cops showed up and
shut the party down.  I can say my only disappointment with this party was
not being able to see more than 5 minutes of the Fingermonsters!

But on the real, Chuck, you had a kickin' ass party, everyone I ran into was
enjoying themselves.  When is the next one???

I was so pleased to be part of this event.=A0 =0AAs some may know I'm a big=
 proponent of the multi-genre thing and wanted this to work and it did.=A0 =
This event not only crossed the genre gap, but it mixed people from many di=
fferent scenes as well.=A0 There are good things about this and bad things,=
 but I feel that its important to the scene to keep trying it.=A0 This was =
the first party at which I've actually encountered a live "prostitot" for e=
xample.=A0 I even talked to two of them which was sort of weird...=0AThe ve=
nue had pros and cons.=A0 The space was pretty cool and would have been eve=
n better if the outside could have been used to full effect.=A0 When we fir=
st got there I wasn't sure that this party would make it to midnight=A0 bec=
ause of the proximity of residential units, so getting broken up at 3AM was=

onfronting an unfamilar mixer as well.=A0 I am pretty sure I beat Pinkko to=

Srsly u guise. U guise. Srsly.

This was a fuckin awesome night, I had a total blast playing dnb, and
totallly got off on the fact that there were candykids there dancing to my
set. It really felt like the first party I ever went to. It was that fuckin
awesome. Can't wait to do that shit again. THANKS CHUCK G!

On Mon, Jul 21, 2008 at 1:15 PM, <dangrsmind@yahoo.com> wrote:

> I was so pleased to be part of this event.
> As some may know I'm a big proponent of the multi-genre thing and wanted
> this to work and it did.  This event not only crossed the genre gap, but it
> mixed people from many different scenes as well.  There are good things
> about this and bad things, but I feel that its important to the scene to
> keep trying it.  This was the first party at which I've actually encountered
> a live "prostitot" for example.  I even talked to two of them which was sort
> of weird...
> The venue had pros and cons.  The space was pretty cool and would have been
> even better if the outside could have been used to full effect.  When we
> first got there I wasn't sure that this party would make it to midnight
> because of the proximity of residential units, so getting broken up at 3AM
> was actually an amazing achievement.  Good job of handling those
> issues by ChuckG.  I'm guessing this venue is going to have a short shelf
> life in that neighborhood however.
> As far as my set I planned to play a mxiture of house and techno.  But that
> fell apart quickly.  I don't have a lot of experience playing for other
> people and so I was nervous when I got there.  That was compounded when I
> found out that the left deck wasn't working quite right since I only play
> vinyl.  On top of that I was confronting an unfamilar mixer as well.  I am
> pretty sure I beat Pinkko to the first train wreck of the night, though I
> did at least a few mixes as intended.  :(
> I got my first raver heart when I wrecked though which was nice.  And some
> of the prostitots danced.  Special thanks to Michael for holding the needle
> to keep it from skipping while I tried to mix...
> Caught the end of Michael's techno set and enjoyed it!  You should play
> more techno!   Ben Haus played a great set which I enjoyed dancing to.  Ben
> and I had never met f2f before so it was nice to put a face with the person.
> I really enjoyed the Fingermonsters as always and Santiago and Bushido
> dropped some fun tracks.  Caught the end of Marc(o)'s set upstairs which was
> great as always!  Saw Pinkko upstairs around this point and he was yawning!
> Dude I hae 20 years on you and I was not yawning!
> Audrey and I split up for a while and she was digging Dean set upstairs
> while I was out in back for a bit.  She said Dean dropped the best tracks of
> the night in her opinion.
> Sound systems were pretty good throughout. Clean and loud but not
> overwhelming.  The visuals in back were nice, but had a very different feel
> than Terry's work.  Terry you were missed!
>
> One funny moment was when the cops first showed up to the event earlier in
> the evening.  I was upstairs in the kitchen where bunch of older people were
> hanging out talking and drinking beer.  And some guy was doing astrology
> readings in there.  Oh did I mention this party had free beer?  FREE BEER?!
> Ok, anyway, the cop opens the door looks in and gets this very confused look
> on his face because outside is this rave, and inside is a bunch of old
> people sittign around talking.  It was almost like were the parents of the
> kids having this party.  I think he might have actually believed that was
> what was going on.  Too funny!
> After the party was broken up, we weren't ready to go home and didn't know
> what else was happening.  It is 3AM on a Saturday night in San Franciso and
> we're not ready to go home yet, so we naturally headed over to the End
> Up. As it turns out, the party there last Saturday is a breaks event from a
> bunch Sister SF DJs and it was jumping pretty good!
> We danced some more and I got my first ever "fist bump".  Met Andrew who
> was "sober as a judge" and was a fun person to dance with.  One guy kept
> rubbing my head with cold water which was good.  the DJ was Smoove and he
> was OK...at least until he played a remix of that "move it move it" song.
> That's in the soundtrack to the movie Madagascar and my kids have watched it
> so much that I never ever need to hear that song again.
> Peace,
> Peter
> PS Flip camera found!  It was in my record bag under my CaliGrown Events
> shirt which I am sporting today...
>
>

Subject: RE: [sfraves] Re: AFN



Hooo boy...AFN was good times. I could try and write a super well thought o=
ut review=2C but it seems like most everyone who has commented touched on m=
ost of the points I woulda brought up (like the 1st cop interaction in the =
keg room that Peter mentioned...that shit was funny!)

All in all=2C despite the little kids and cops showing up twice (I'm amazed=
 it took so long the 2nd time around)=2C I thought the party rocked. The li=
neup was great=2C the genre and crowd mixing was a nice change of pace. Peo=
ple seemed very friendly overall=2C even the mini-thugs from Richmond. ( I =
wound up kind of keeping an eye on them all night after they got all riled =
up during the bottle incident=2C and for the most part they were actually p=
retty nice kids)

My set was "eh". It had moments I loved=2C and moments I hated. This was th=
e 1st event I had an honest to goodness cd malfunction...one of my tracks d=
idn't burn all the way through and just cut off mid mix...OOPS! Beyond that=
 though=2C I had fun. Peter sounded good despite the tone-arm/needle issue =
with one of his decks (good job soldiering through that!)=2C Michael's tech=
no was on point big time=2C as was Pinkko's set=2C Holt sounded really frig=
gin' good=2C and what I heard of Dean and The Fingermonsters was great too.=
 Who really impressed the fuck out of me=2C were Santiago & Bushido. They f=
ucking tore it up!!! I have never heard Chicago house sound so beast!!! The=
y need to come back...and not to another kiddy rave like they played at the=
 night before at Kelly's Mission Rock...oh no no. They need to be at a nice=
 (adult) underground=2C hahaha.=20

Man=2C I think I saw more prostitots and kiddy ravers this weekend between =
promotions and the party Saturday than I have in years. It was very strange=
.=20

My observation in regards to this...back in the day=2C kiddy ravers had big=
 fucking pants...now it seems like the style is "no fucking pants"=2C as a =
good 3/4's of those little girls were wearing nothing but panties over tigh=
ts. Had they not been mere children by most standards=2C that might have be=
en hot. But that young...it was borderline creepy.

Anyway...massive respect and props to Chuck G and Caligrown for another ama=
zing effort and heartfelt event. Chuck is hand to god one of the nicest=2C =
most sincere and genuine people I have met since moving out here=2C and I g=
ot nothing but love for what he's involved in=2C for who he hangs out with=
=2C and for him as a human being. My hat is off.....

~ Marco

p.s. It was super awesome fun time happy rave-o-matic meeting new folks lik=
e Mary & Holt=2C etc. !!!!!

>> I was so pleased to be part of this event.
>> As some may know I'm a big proponent of the multi-genre thing and wanted
>> this to work and it did.  This event not only crossed the genre gap=2C b=
ut it
>> mixed people from many different scenes as well.  There are good things
>> about this and bad things=2C but I feel that its important to the scene =
to
>> keep trying it.  This was the first party at which I've actually encount=
ered
>> a live "prostitot" for example.  I even talked to two of them which was =
sort
>> of weird...
>> The venue had pros and cons.  The space was pretty cool and would have b=
een
>> even better if the outside could have been used to full effect.  When we

sed look

he

and

>> Up. As it turns out=2C the party there last Saturday is a breaks event f=
rom a

>> We danced some more and I got my first ever "fist bump".  Met Andrew who

In fact, the Nazi Party began in a gay bar in Munich, and Ernst Roehm,
Hitler's right hand in the early days of Nazism, was well-known for
his taste in young boys. William Shirer says in his definitive "Rise
and Fall of the Third Reich," not only that Roehm was "important in
the rise of Hitler," but also "like so many of the early Nazis, (he
was) a homosexual."

- Bryan Fischer

Source:  The Truth About Homosexuality and the Nazi Party,
http://www.renewamerica.us/columns/fischer/080515

From: "Chelsea Faith" <chelcfaith@gmail.com>
To: SFR <sfraves@hyperreal.org>
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: multipart/alternative; 
	boundary="----=_Part_48242_31589156.1216847444353"
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] NRR - Wherever I go, San Francisco follows me. (A small story about German burritos)

------=_Part_48242_31589156.1216847444353
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
Content-Disposition: inline

Hi guys, this is Chelsea and I am in Berlin.  It's 11pm and I'm going to
Tresor in a couple hours to hear Alexander Kowalski, amongst others. The sun
has just set and I'm listening to a duduk player outside my window.
Somehow I have found myself coming all the way here to eat....
California-style burritos??

Mexican food is pretty scarce in the city, and I tend not to seek it out,
for the thought of German Mexican food does not really appeal to me.  But
here in Mitte is this burrito joint called Dolores, which specializes in
"California-style" Mexican food.  The food is okay, standard pseudo-Mexican
yuppie fare such as tofu burritos with brown rice, and of course, for that
extra touch of Bay Area authenticity, organic soy lattes. A panel of cute
and friendly German girls assemble my "Dolores Vegan" burrito for me with a
smile. But the most major "WTF" element of this place for me is the HUGE map
of the Mission covering one entire side of the restaurant.  (The food is
much more Marin than the Mission, but still....)  Much like the actual
Mission, this place is a magnet for fashionable young Americans, and
ordering your food in English is not just acceptable, but expected (perhaps
to go along with the "theme"?)  To match the Californian food, they serve
Anchor Steam beer and bottled Arizona teas imported from the States.  To me
this is very, very strange.

You can read their spunky and colorful menu here - www.dolores-berlin.de

That's all for now,

Love Chelsea

Message-ID: <da3fea7c0807231413y401468a2h16502aaba0a4e497@mail.gmail.com>

From: "Chelsea Faith" <chelcfaith@gmail.com>
To: SFR <sfraves@hyperreal.org>
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: multipart/alternative; 
	boundary="----=_Part_48277_18016466.1216847594261"
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] NRR: Wherever I go, San Francisco follows me. (A small story about German burritos)

------=_Part_48277_18016466.1216847594261
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
Content-Disposition: inline

Hi guys, this is Chelsea and I am in Berlin.  It's 11pm and I'm going to
Tresor in a couple hours to hear Alexander Kowalski, amongst others. The sun
has just set and I'm listening to a duduk player outside my window.
Somehow I have found myself coming all the way here to eat....
California-style burritos??

Mexican food is pretty scarce in the city, and I tend not to seek it out,
for the thought of German Mexican food does not really appeal to me.  But
here in Mitte is this burrito joint called Dolores, which specializes in
"California-style" Mexican food.  The food is okay, standard pseudo-Mexican
yuppie fare such as tofu burritos with brown rice, and of course, for that
extra touch of Bay Area authenticity, organic soy lattes. A panel of cute
and friendly German girls assemble my "Dolores Vegan" burrito for me with a
smile. But the most major "WTF" element of this place for me is the HUGE map
of the Mission covering one entire side of the restaurant.  (The food is
much more Marin than the Mission, but still....)  Much like the actual
Mission, this place is a magnet for fashionable young Americans, and
ordering your food in English is not just acceptable, but expected (perhaps
to go along with the "theme"?)  To match the Californian food, they serve
Anchor Steam beer and bottled Arizona teas imported from the States.  To me
this is very, very strange.

You can read their spunky and colorful menu here - www.dolores-berlin.de

That's all for now,

Love Chelsea

------=_Part_48277_18016466.1216847594261--

Subject: [sfraves] BSP: 8/8 - 8/10 Mendonesia Free Camp Out

------=_Part_142444_28792304.1216854689454
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
Content-Disposition: inline

How many camp outs have there been in 2008, at least a dozen so far it seems
like, with more to come before the year ends.  The high ticket prices of
some of these events provide exquisite deco and setups, top notch sound and
lighting, and world class talent.  For all of you that were unable to attend
all of your favorite camp outs because of financial restraints, this party
is for you- and all free party loving people everywhere!

The Acid Totem sound system returns to its renegade roots.  Imagine a party
based on the very foundation of early rave culture, the FREE SOUND SYSTEM.
Fill your car with all your friends and camping gear, and head to the
Mendocino National Forest for the first ever MENDONESIA.  A 3 hour drive
from SF, Oakland, and Sacramento, and just over 2 hours from Santa Rosa.

This is an intimate and free campout, since we aren't charging, everyone is
expected to pack out their own trash (trash bags will be provided).  There
is also extreme fire danger in the area, so no fire of any kind outside of
campsite fire rings. Pit toilets are on site, but there is no running
water.  It gets HOT here during the day, and is relatively cool at night.
Sunscreen for the daytime, and extra layers at night are recommended.  There
is plenty of shade in the campground, but early arrival is recommended to
ensure a premium site.  Did we mention there's a creek that runs right next
to the background?

Check out pix of the area:  http://www.acidtotem.net/mendonesia.htm

You can expect to hear a myriad of sounds and talented DJs from the many
subscenes of Northern California dance culture.  Party will be kicking off
Friday evening circa 6pm.

Although the party is free, donations are greatly appreciated.  Feed the
Totem god and keep him happy!


And finally, the line-up:

Selector Science  <Mendocino>
Razvan <Black market Techno>
Dcoy <Black Market Techno>
Evinrude <Net Amp Radio>
Dirt <Wilderbeats>
J. Rogers <Blipswitch / Surya Dub>
Sean Knight <Blipswitch>
Bam <Evil Breaks>
Actual Rafiq <Ambient Mafia>
Ivan <Delta Funk>
Flook <Acid Totem / Purgatory Cruiser>
Aleks <Acid Totem / Nocturnalism>
Chuck G <Cali Grown>
Kris Kent <Acid Totem>
Unityvybe < Acid Totem>
Ben Haus <Acid Totem / Qpod>
5-MeO <Acid Totem / 5-MeO>

------=_Part_142444_28792304.1216854689454--

Subject: [sfraves] Techno Manifesto

I found this months article on pitchfork about the state of techno  
(haha!) rather entertaining, and somewhat informative (in that  
pitchfork run-on-sentence-I'm-smarter-than-you sort of way):

"...Even electronic dance music, which once spun blithely under a  
yellow smiley face, seems uncommonly sober these days-- self-critical,  
nail-biting, a buzzkill to the extreme. Minimal, of course, was the  
straw that overflowed the glass of Red Bull. Scapegoat or no, in the  
last 18 months, the ubiquitous and yet strangely ephemeral genre has  
become a lightning rod for every conceivable critique. It's too  
soulless. It all sounds the same. It's lost touch with the roots of  
"real" dance music. It might not be surprising to hear a DJ like Diplo  
tell Pitchfork, "I go to a club in Berlin and I want to kill myself."  
But even within the scene, everyone complains about minimal, leveling  
complaints that often seem indicative of a much wider unease.... "

Especially interesting are the last contribution bits from producers  
as general guidelines when creating tracks. Of course, there are no  
guidelines, but it is still an interesting take.


http://www.pitchforkmedia.com/article/feature/142152-the-month-in-techno

---------------------------------------------------------------------

Subject: Re: [sfraves] NRR - Wherever I go, San Francisco follows me. (A small
 story about German burritos)

god i'm jealous but also so sad. i will meet up with you soon for 
falafel `;(

Chelsea Faith wrote:
> Hi guys, this is Chelsea and I am in Berlin.  It's 11pm and I'm going to
> Tresor in a couple hours to hear Alexander Kowalski, amongst others. The sun
> has just set and I'm listening to a duduk player outside my window.
> Somehow I have found myself coming all the way here to eat....
> California-style burritos??
>
> Mexican food is pretty scarce in the city, and I tend not to seek it out,
> for the thought of German Mexican food does not really appeal to me.  But
> here in Mitte is this burrito joint called Dolores, which specializes in
> "California-style" Mexican food.  The food is okay, standard pseudo-Mexican
> yuppie fare such as tofu burritos with brown rice, and of course, for that
> extra touch of Bay Area authenticity, organic soy lattes. A panel of cute
> and friendly German girls assemble my "Dolores Vegan" burrito for me with a
> smile. But the most major "WTF" element of this place for me is the HUGE map
> of the Mission covering one entire side of the restaurant.  (The food is
> much more Marin than the Mission, but still....)  Much like the actual
> Mission, this place is a magnet for fashionable young Americans, and
> ordering your food in English is not just acceptable, but expected (perhaps
> to go along with the "theme"?)  To match the Californian food, they serve
> Anchor Steam beer and bottled Arizona teas imported from the States.  To me
> this is very, very strange.
>
> You can read their spunky and colorful menu here - www.dolores-berlin.de
>
> That's all for now,
>
> Love Chelsea
>
>   

--

----- Original Message ----
From: Holt Sorenson <hso@hsomusic.com>
To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
Sent: Monday, July 28, 2008 9:58:00 AM
Subject: [sfraves] BSP: This week on KZSU - Rick Preston / pinkko


Please tune in to KZSU by listening to 90.1 in the Bay Area or pointing
your web browser to http://kzsulive.stanford.edu.

If you're interested in guest appearing on any of our shows
or having a mix featured contact us using our email addresses
or: electronicadjs@kzsu.stanford.edu

Big Love Show with Jack - Mon 3PM-6PM Pacific/US
------------------------------------------------

This week Jack will be hosting Rick Preston.

Whether you experience Rick Preston's Dj sets in a packed club with
half naked bodies pulsating and gyrating around you in the thick
vibe, or if its at a huge rave with lasers and thousands of heads
jumping and screaming, or at a park on that sunny afternoon with
kids and families all getting down to the funky rhythms together in
unison, its always guaranteed that you will have the biggest smile
of your face after dancing to his music.

Although he started off his career playing Disco and Funk in the
early 80's, Rick used his experience in the booming 80's alternative
scene to hone his DJing skills. Rick would be part of various
nighttime gatherings for friends in bars and night clubs, leading
their nights with swooning tunes and industrial beats. And as the
music progressed, so would Rick's attraction to what would lead to
an even bigger movement, Electronic Music.

In the early 90's, Rick became involved with promotion alongside his
frequent Dj gigs. Amongst some of the Bay Area greats, such as Jeno,
Garth, Mark Farina, Spun, and Julius Papp, Rick was helping put on
club nights and raves in their beginning stages, when the
underground at its strongest.

While his DJ sets are mostly considered deep house, they are not
limited to just the deep sound. Rick has a special flair for
bringing together a multitude of genres which can include tribal
rhythms, some tech-house, some Latin textures, a classic track or
two, or even a mind awakening spoken word.

As a producer, Preston's motto of quality not quantity has stood him
in good stead with some superb labels, notably Glasgow Underground,
home to Mateo & Matos, Romanthony, and Neon Heights. He also has
releases on AfterHours, Viva! Recordings, Freeze Records, Big Big
Trax, and BCE.

More about Rick:
http://hsomusic.com/sh/10

Eclektronik Groove w/ Holt Sorenson - Mon 9AM-12PM Pacific/US
--------------------------------------------------------------

pinkko is destroying the decks with insane drum and bass.
When I asked him for a bio, he said "FUCK CAPITALISM!" He
has a promo mix you can download at:
http://hsomusic.com/sh/11

His myspace is at:
http://hsomusic.com/sh/12

Holt will be gone the next two weeks and will be back on
air August 18th. As always, you can check his schedule
on his myspace:

http://myspace.com/hsomusic

Epiphany of Sound with J.C. - Th 9AM-12PM Pacific/US
----------------------------------------------------

After 14 years, DJ J.C.'s techno/house/electronica showcase has
garnered much attention and devotion. Like most folks at Stanford's
radio station, he's a volunteer, proving that his motivation isn't
a paycheck; it's his passion to share his interest in one of music's
most eclectic genres. With his conversational style, inclusion of
producers and musicians from both the local & international scene,
and his stewardship of the station's 24-hour marathons during
Solstices and Equinoxes, it's no wonder that DJ J.C has made a
connection with listeners in a very crowded market. Catch his live
broadcasts or listen to the previous week's program at underheard.org.

J.C. will email this week if he has an update on any guests.

--
Holt Sorenson/Eclektronik Groove
hso@hsomusic.com
hsomusic.com - myspace.com/hsomusic
KZSU (kzsulive.stanford.edu) show Th @ 6-9AM US/Pacific

For additional commands, e-mail: sfraves-help@hyperreal.org

Subject: [sfraves] nrr bsp: live-coding presentation tomorrow night (music geeks/programmers will dig)

http://electronicmusic.meetup.com/152/calendar/8221557/

Tomorrow night I'll be back in the Bay to give a presentation on a
system I built. It has two major use cases currently. One is
generating infinite streams of ambient music, like AI windchimes, and
the other is live-coding beats, e.g.:

http://vimeo.com/947877

I did a DJ set with it also in Toronto recently at a programming
conference pre-party. Hate to say it but the set operated much better
as a technology demo than it did as an actual DJ set. Still, I DJed a
party by modifying code as it ran - not a great UI but a fantastic
proof of concept.

At some point this year or next year this system will be able to
generate infinite streams of fully-fledged techno on its own - aided
and abetted, of course, by prosumer software like Reason and Live. It
can already do infinite streams of sample-driven ambient and I've
already got outline code for features like melody and chord
progressions.

The talk is code-intensive; if you're not a programmer, you might be
bored and/or confused. There's several other interesting things
happening the same night, wicked cool music innovation, so if you dig
that kind of thing, come on by.

Tuesday @ 7:30pm at the offices of Digidesign.

http://electronicmusic.meetup.com/152/calendar/8221557/

-- 

Giles Soundwave/Goat Boy/Bowkett
http://www.gilesgoatboy.org/
http://gilesbowkett.blogspot.com (code)

Subject: [sfraves] BSP: new mix - verbover killaz

with much blood, sweat, and fear of lost hearing i present
_verbover killaz_

a 63min diversion into a dancefloor's future from a zombie looking back.
electro house . bassline . breaks . dubstep . nichestep
28 tracks to blade runner funk your ass.

http://zombie-j.com/wordpress/?p=20

BUY NOW - Bodycrash (original mix)
Chromeo - Needy Girl (Boy 8-Bit's Talk Box Dub)
Rico Tubbs - Gangsters - Original Mix
Fake Blood - Mars - Original Mix
Hatiras, MC Flipside - Get Blahsted - Original Mix
PYTHONMAN - Python Skank
Si Begg - Are You A Big Boy DJ - Beggline VIP
BEATZ COOL - Das Mach Isch (original mix)
GENERAL MIDI - Milton (Dee Zed mix)
DJ TURBULENCE - Bun Dem
DJ TURBULENCE - Jamaican Gangsterz
DJ Fixx, Keith Mackenzie - Feelin' The Luv feat. Yolanda - Twocker Remix
alias - making cents
ABLE, Clark - Lemon Head (Crookers remix)
BAOBINGA & ID - Jump Up Get Hype (Heavyfeet's Raving re-shuffle)
Annabel - Sometimes
Blatta & Inesha - Stoned Walking - Original Mix
SEXUAL CHOCOLATE - What's My Name? (Guy Herman's Answer mix)
Daniele Papini - Church Of Nonsense - Original Mix
DJ Slugo - I Ain't Yo Baby Daddy
DJ Blaqstarr - Shake It To The Ground feat. Rye Rye - Drop The Lime Remix
THE COUNT OF MONTE CRISTAL - Dibby DJ (original mix)
Curses - What I Need - Drop The Lime VIP
3D, Elemental - Ska Train - Original Mix
Kromestar - Pass Da Spliff - Original Mix
M.I. Loki - Set It Off - Original Mix
EmalKay - My Story - Original Mix

Subject: [sfraves] Re: nrr bsp: live-coding presentation tomorrow night (music geeks/programmers will dig)

Hey all, bit spammy, very sorry, but just wanted to mention, I'm also
going to pontificate a bit on my theory of the MP3-era music business.
Very much just a theory - haven't made it work yet - but it's quite
complete and forms the basis of the technology so it could be
interesting. Hope to see you there.

On Mon, Jul 28, 2008 at 5:01 PM, Giles Bowkett <dj.soundwave@gmail.com> wrote:
> http://electronicmusic.meetup.com/152/calendar/8221557/
>
> Tomorrow night I'll be back in the Bay to give a presentation on a
> system I built. It has two major use cases currently. One is
> generating infinite streams of ambient music, like AI windchimes, and
> the other is live-coding beats, e.g.:
>
> http://vimeo.com/947877
>
> I did a DJ set with it also in Toronto recently at a programming
> conference pre-party. Hate to say it but the set operated much better
> as a technology demo than it did as an actual DJ set. Still, I DJed a
> party by modifying code as it ran - not a great UI but a fantastic
> proof of concept.
>
> At some point this year or next year this system will be able to
> generate infinite streams of fully-fledged techno on its own - aided
> and abetted, of course, by prosumer software like Reason and Live. It
> can already do infinite streams of sample-driven ambient and I've
> already got outline code for features like melody and chord
> progressions.
>
> The talk is code-intensive; if you're not a programmer, you might be
> bored and/or confused. There's several other interesting things
> happening the same night, wicked cool music innovation, so if you dig
> that kind of thing, come on by.
>
> Tuesday @ 7:30pm at the offices of Digidesign.
>
> http://electronicmusic.meetup.com/152/calendar/8221557/
>
> --
>
> Giles Soundwave/Goat Boy/Bowkett
> http://www.gilesgoatboy.org/
> http://gilesbowkett.blogspot.com (code)
>



-- 

Giles Soundwave/Goat Boy/Bowkett
http://www.gilesgoatboy.org/
http://gilesbowkett.blogspot.com (code)

I DID IT FOR THE LULZ

On Mon, Jul 28, 2008 at 10:47 AM, CHUCK G <chuckg_421@yahoo.com> wrote:

> Been tuned in for 37 mins, Pinkko is tearing sh!t up! Even my boss walked
> by my desk & started bangin his head, lawlz. . .
>

>

>
>
> ----- Original Message ----
> From: Holt Sorenson <hso@hsomusic.com>
> To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
> Sent: Monday, July 28, 2008 9:58:00 AM
> Subject: [sfraves] BSP: This week on KZSU - Rick Preston / pinkko
>
>
> Please tune in to KZSU by listening to 90.1 in the Bay Area or pointing
> your web browser to http://kzsulive.stanford.edu.
>
> If you're interested in guest appearing on any of our shows
> or having a mix featured contact us using our email addresses
> or: electronicadjs@kzsu.stanford.edu
>
> Big Love Show with Jack - Mon 3PM-6PM Pacific/US
> ------------------------------------------------
>
> This week Jack will be hosting Rick Preston.
>
> Whether you experience Rick Preston's Dj sets in a packed club with
> half naked bodies pulsating and gyrating around you in the thick
> vibe, or if its at a huge rave with lasers and thousands of heads
> jumping and screaming, or at a park on that sunny afternoon with
> kids and families all getting down to the funky rhythms together in
> unison, its always guaranteed that you will have the biggest smile
> of your face after dancing to his music.
>
> Although he started off his career playing Disco and Funk in the
> early 80's, Rick used his experience in the booming 80's alternative
> scene to hone his DJing skills. Rick would be part of various
> nighttime gatherings for friends in bars and night clubs, leading
> their nights with swooning tunes and industrial beats. And as the
> music progressed, so would Rick's attraction to what would lead to
> an even bigger movement, Electronic Music.
>
> In the early 90's, Rick became involved with promotion alongside his
> frequent Dj gigs. Amongst some of the Bay Area greats, such as Jeno,
> Garth, Mark Farina, Spun, and Julius Papp, Rick was helping put on
> club nights and raves in their beginning stages, when the
> underground at its strongest.
>
> While his DJ sets are mostly considered deep house, they are not
> limited to just the deep sound. Rick has a special flair for
> bringing together a multitude of genres which can include tribal
> rhythms, some tech-house, some Latin textures, a classic track or
> two, or even a mind awakening spoken word.
>
> As a producer, Preston's motto of quality not quantity has stood him
> in good stead with some superb labels, notably Glasgow Underground,
> home to Mateo & Matos, Romanthony, and Neon Heights. He also has
> releases on AfterHours, Viva! Recordings, Freeze Records, Big Big
> Trax, and BCE.
>
> More about Rick:
> http://hsomusic.com/sh/10
>
> Eclektronik Groove w/ Holt Sorenson - Mon 9AM-12PM Pacific/US
> --------------------------------------------------------------
>
> pinkko is destroying the decks with insane drum and bass.
> When I asked him for a bio, he said "FUCK CAPITALISM!" He
> has a promo mix you can download at:
> http://hsomusic.com/sh/11
>
> His myspace is at:
> http://hsomusic.com/sh/12
>
> Holt will be gone the next two weeks and will be back on
> air August 18th. As always, you can check his schedule
> on his myspace:
>
> http://myspace.com/hsomusic
>
> Epiphany of Sound with J.C. - Th 9AM-12PM Pacific/US
> ----------------------------------------------------
>
> After 14 years, DJ J.C.'s techno/house/electronica showcase has
> garnered much attention and devotion. Like most folks at Stanford's
> radio station, he's a volunteer, proving that his motivation isn't
> a paycheck; it's his passion to share his interest in one of music's
> most eclectic genres. With his conversational style, inclusion of
> producers and musicians from both the local & international scene,
> and his stewardship of the station's 24-hour marathons during
> Solstices and Equinoxes, it's no wonder that DJ J.C has made a
> connection with listeners in a very crowded market. Catch his live
> broadcasts or listen to the previous week's program at underheard.org.
>
> J.C. will email this week if he has an update on any guests.
>
> --
> Holt Sorenson/Eclektronik Groove
> hso@hsomusic.com
> hsomusic.com - myspace.com/hsomusic
> KZSU (kzsulive.stanford.edu) show Th @ 6-9AM US/Pacific

Subject: [sfraves] SRR: cool roomie wanted by sept.

hello all. our one enclosed room in our loft is opening up at the end of 
august. we're looking for someone who his into techno or other 
interesting music. must not be completely insane or completely square. 
good god there are alot of square people out there.
 i post something like 'we play loud music 24-7'
and all i get are replies like "i'm a quiet software engineer who who 
likes to keep to himself and i don't really consider myself a partier"
-i'm like, "you're so L7!"

so if you think you're down and are a cool person that needs a place to 
stay, please check the link to the c-list post below.

http://sfbay.craigslist.org/eby/roo/774993439.html

look forward to chatting

Subject: Re: [sfraves] NRR: Black Music for White People

------=_Part_63785_25133929.1217369200712
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
Content-Disposition: inline

I was watching The John McCain Old Man's Channel, Turner Classic Movies,
this past weekend and they were having themselves an Annette
Funicello/Frankie Avalon Beach Blanket Bingo movie marathon over there for
all the old folk that wanted to relive the glory days of their
pre-psychedelic youth and during the Muscle Beach Party movie, which came
out in 1964.  http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0058384/ my jaw just dropped when
out of the blue, an insanely young Stevie Wonder came out of nowhere and did
a song.

Totally mind blowing.

Little Stevie Wonder, (that's how he's credited in his first ever feature
film appearance, check the IMDB link above), is like all of14 yrs old at the
time of the filming and they've got him singing not only in the movie but
over the closing credits as well, which is a real head twist because the
entire rest of the flick is nothing but Dick Dale and The Mighty Del Tones
surf music.

And really, really, rilly bad acting.

If you ever spot it on the TV dial it's worth watching the closing credits
just for that.

~Nyc

.
